Package bio.singa.mathematics.metrics.model

Interface Metric<MetrizableType>

  • Type Parameters:
    MetrizableType - A reference to the type of object that is to be compared.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AngularDistance, CosineSimilarity, EuclideanDistance, JaccardMetric, MinkowskiMetric, OverlapDistance, ShortestPathMetric, SquaredEuclideanDistance, TanimotoCoefficient
    public interface Metric<MetrizableType>
    A metric or distance function is a function that defines a distance between each pair of elements of a set. A metric needs to be non-negative, symmetric, has a identity of indiscernibles, and satisfies the triangle inequality.
    See Also:
    Wikipedia: Metric

    • Method Detail

      • calculateDistance

        double calculateDistance​(MetrizableType first,
                         MetrizableType second)
        Calculates the distance between both Objects. The order of the input does not matter as every metric is symmetric.
        Parameters:
        first - The first object.
        second - The second object.
        Returns:
        Their distance.

      • calculateDistancesPairwise

        default <SubType extends MetrizableType> SymmetricMatrix calculateDistancesPairwise​(java.util.List<SubType> list)
        Calculates the pairwise distance of all elements in the given list. Every distance is only calculated once. The indices of the list are preserved (the distance from the first to the second element in the list can be retrieved with getElement(0,1) or getElement(1,0)).
        Type Parameters:
        SubType - The type or a subtype of this Metric type.
        Parameters:
        list - The list of elements.
        Returns:
        A SymmetricMatrix (in this case called distance matrix) with the pairwise distances.
        See Also:
        Wikipedia: Distance matrix

      • calculateDistancesPairwise

        default <SubType extends MetrizableType> Matrix calculateDistancesPairwise​(java.util.List<SubType> list1,
                                                                           java.util.List<SubType> list2)
        Computes pairwise distances for two given lists, resulting in a rectangular, non-symmetric matric.
        Type Parameters:
        SubType - The metrizable type.
        Parameters:
        list1 - The firts list.
        list2 - The second list.
        Returns:
        A rectangular matrix with pairwise distances.

                                                                                                                      java.util.function.Function<LabelType,​SubType> function)

      • calculateDistancesToReference

        default <SubType extends MetrizableType> java.util.Map<SubType,​java.lang.Double> calculateDistancesToReference​(java.util.List<SubType> list,
                                                                                                                     SubType reference)
        Calculates the distance for each Vector in the given target list to the reference vector.
        Type Parameters:
        SubType - The Type or Subtype of the Metrizable.
        Parameters:
        list - The list of targets.
        reference - The reference vector.
        Returns:
        A mapping of the target vector to its distance.

      • calculateClosestDistance

        default <SubType extends MetrizableType> java.util.Map.Entry<SubType,​java.lang.Double> calculateClosestDistance​(java.util.List<SubType> list,
                                                                                                                      SubType reference)
        Returns the closest element in the given target list to the reference vector.
        Type Parameters:

        reference - The reference vector.
        Returns:
        A Entry with the closest element and its distance.
